trans-unit.source: Represents the endpoint for a service that allows clients of the service to find and communicate with the service.
The service endpoint contains the information about the address, binding, contract, and behavior required by a client to find and interact with the service at this endpoint.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint"></xref> class for a specified contract.
Use this constructor when the binding and address for the endpoint are provided in configuration.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription"></xref> for the service endpoint.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint"></xref> class with a specified contract, binding, and address.
Use this constructor to specify a service endpoint imperatively in code.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription"></xref> for the service endpoint.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding"></xref> that specifies how the service endpoint communicates with the world.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress"></xref> for the service endpoint.
Gets or sets the endpoint address for the service endpoint.

The default value of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint.ListenUri%2A> at which the service endpoint listens is provided by <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress.Uri%2A> of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress> returned by <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint.Address%2A>.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress"></xref> that specifies the location of the service endpoint.
Gets the behaviors for the service endpoint.
The type of behavior that is accessible from the description hierarchy is scoped to the specific level.
From the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IEndpointBehavior> is accessible.

If you want access to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IContractBehavior> associated with an endpoint, you can obtain the contact for the endpoint using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint.Contract%2A> property.

Then call the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription.Behaviors%2A> property to obtain the <xref:System.Collections.Generic.KeyedByTypeCollection%601> of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IContractBehavior> objects associated with the endpoint.

The <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.KeyedByTypeCollection`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.IEndpointBehavior"></xref> that contains the behaviors specified for the service endpoint.
Gets or sets the binding for the service endpoint.
The binding for an endpoint can also be specified in the configuration file in the [\<bindings\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/wcf/bindings.md) element.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding"></xref> for the service endpoint.
Gets the contract for the service endpoint.
Each service endpoint has a unique contract.

From the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription>, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescriptionCollection> for the methods contained in the contract can be accessed using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription.Operations%2A> property.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription"></xref> that specifies the contract for the service endpoint.
Gets the endpoint behaviors for the service.
The endpoint behaviors for the service.
Gets or sets whether the service endpoint is generated by the system as opposed to being user-defined.
`true` if the service endpoint is generated by the system; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the URI at which the service endpoint listens.
The value can also be set using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ServiceEndpointElement.ListenUri%2A> property.
The <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> at which the service endpoint listens.

The default value is provided by <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress.Uri"></xref> of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress"></xref> returned by <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint.Address"></xref>.
Gets or sets how the transport handles the URI that is provided for the service to listen on.
The value of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ListenUriMode> is used to determine how the transport handles the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint.ListenUri%2A>.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ListenUriMode"></xref> for the service endpoint.
The default value is <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ListenUriMode.Explicit"></xref>.
Gets or sets the name of the service endpoint.
Services may have multiple endpoints, so the endpoint <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint.Name%2A> is distinct from the name of the service.
The service name is accessed using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.Name%2A> property.
When accessed from the service, this property is populated by the <endpoint name="`endpointName`"\> configuration element.
When accessed on the client, this property is `null`.
When the property getter is called (again on the client) it populates this property with a default value based on the contract and binding.
The name the service endpoint.
The default value is the concatenation of the binding name and the contract description name.
For example, <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding.Name"></xref> +'_' + <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription.Name"></xref>.
